comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Same view earlier, by Charles Bayliss - nla.gov.au/nla.pic-vn4236855

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: The Sydney Rowing Club Headquarters...per a sketch which appeared in the Sydney Mail, 2/11/1878, p. 689 [issue not available via Google News Archive...it's on microfilm]...the SRC HQ is the building we see here partly here obscured by smoke...the 1878 Sydney Mail sketch depicts a similar state of development to the Charles Bayliss pic (see Beachcomber's link)...the larger building which we see here to the left of the SRC HQ (also possibly a boat shed) didn't make it into the 1878 Sydney Mail sketch. I'm fairly certain that the buildings to the lhs in the foreground are the Mercantile Rowing Club boat shed(s) and clubhouse, which were at Dawes Point for a number of years...see comments at www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2554615575/

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Per this June 1888 SMH item, the site of the Sydney Rowing Club boat shed at Fort Macquarie was about to be resumed for the erection of wharves - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article28343873 ...which suggests that this pic was taken before ca. mid 1888.
